External Integration

This integration process is designed to be efficient and straightforward, requiring minimal effort from our partners. There is no need to integrate extensive SDK features and the guild management UI will be seamlessly provided by the Shards app. Partners are only required to link their profile through our Portal, reducing friction in user experience.

Process​

Step 1: Create account in self-integration portal​

Refer to the Environment setup section for more details

Step 2: Install SDK package based on game engine​

Refer to the Game Client section for more details

Step 3: Link profile​

Partner can either link profile using MiraiId or userGameId

Option 1: By MiraiId​

Link profile API

We provide an API for the linking feature with details given below

  • Endpoint: PUT /v1/user-mirai/add-mirai
  • Authorization
    • Guarded by ApiKeyGuard
    • Requires Api key (api-key)
  • Headers
    • api-key: <api_key>
  • Request Body: The request body should be a JSON object with the following fields
{
  "userId": "User ID in partner's game",
  "miraiId": "User Mirai ID",
  "clientId": "The ID of the game client"
}

Step-by-step guide

  1. Partners should prepare an UI for the linking function, entering user MiraiId
  2. As user confirmed, the Link profile API should be called
  3. On success, user should be redirected to Game details page on Shards App for guild management

Option 2: By userGameId​

As partner creates a new game, it's assigned a random key used to encode in-game user ID in field encodeUserIdKey (More info in this API). We're using AES-256-CBC encryption algorithm to encode game user ID, here are some implementations in different languages that partner can refer to

Javascript 
const crypto = require('crypto');

const IV_LENGTH = 16; // For AES

// `text` equals plain game user ID
function encrypt(text) {
  // This is the encode key from `encodeUserIdKey` field
  const encryptKey = 'VlbEROErE26MHoKdKEMgM2kgeWobvNjr';
  const iv = crypto.randomBytes(IV_LENGTH);
  const cipher = crypto.createCipheriv(
    'aes-256-cbc',
    Buffer.from(encryptKey),
    iv
  );
  let encrypted = cipher.update(text);
  encrypted = Buffer.concat([encrypted, cipher.final()]);
  return `${iv.toString('hex')}:${encrypted.toString('hex')}`;
}

Python
import base64
import os
from Crypto.Cipher import AES
from Crypto.Util.Padding import pad

IV_LENGTH = 16  # For AES

# `text` equals plain game user ID
def encrypt(text):
    # This is the encode key from `encodeUserIdKey` field
    encrypt_key = b'VlbEROErE26MHoKdKEMgM2kgeWobvNjr'
    iv = os.urandom(IV_LENGTH)
    cipher = AES.new(encrypt_key, AES.MODE_CBC, iv)
    encrypted = cipher.encrypt(pad(text.encode('utf-8'), AES.block_size))
    return f"{iv.hex()}:{encrypted.hex()}"
PHP
// `text` equals plain game user ID
function encrypt($text) {
    // This is the encode key from `encodeUserIdKey` field
    $encryptKey = 'VlbEROErE26MHoKdKEMgM2kgeWobvNjr';
    $ivLength = openssl_cipher_iv_length('aes-256-cbc');
    $iv = openssl_random_pseudo_bytes($ivLength);
    $encrypted = openssl_encrypt($text, 'aes-256-cbc', $encryptKey, 0, $iv);
    return bin2hex($iv) . ':' . bin2hex(base64_decode($encrypted));
}

Therefore, the linking feature can easily be arranged in the Shards App where user only need to provide the encoded userGameId

note

Both options can be implemented simultaneously, partner can freely choose which suits them best
